message:
what in my config might be causing a simple thing like this to break:
line:  foo foo foo foo foo
:s/foo/bar/g
result: bar foo foo foo foo

Thanks that did it exactly - one of the problem with the more complex vim setup you have is you don't always know which plugins or addons might be changing something - but in this case it was something from the vimrc I started with
out of curiosity - why would one want that set?
Why wouldn't you want it set?
If you run Vim's substitute command without providing any flags, the default behaviour is to replace the first occurrence on each line of the specified range. How often do you need to do that?
In my experience, I always want to replace every occurrence on each line. Enabling the gdefault setting makes that the default behaviour.

@nelstrom dur, your right of course, I didn't read the docs carefully.  I think I just initially tried what I had found from google (to use /g) and when that didn't work, and you pointed out the setting, switching the setting "fixed" the problem - I didn't realize at the time that it was just simply inverting the default.
